keywords.indexterm: Oxygen SDKTesting plugins and Java extensions

body.p:
In the various procedures for creating a plugin, you are usually instructed to copy your plugin folder to the /plugins/ directory. If you want to test the code in your plugin without copying it to that folder, follow this procedure:
Create a file called plugin.redirect that contains the full file path references to your project (for example, C:\Users\john_doe\Documents\sample-plugin-folder).
Save that file in any folder (for example, called sample_test_folder) inside the /plugins/ directory.
Step Result: will automatically load the plugin from your project location.
Now you can modify the Java code, the IDE will automatically compile it, and if the plugin.xml file has a classpath reference to the compiled classes folder, you can restart and test your changes.
